thread.title: FC Dallas takes three-match shutout streak into regular-season finale
thread.title_full: FC Dallas takes three-match shutout streak into regular-season finale | Dallas Morning News

author: Steve Hunt
title: FC Dallas takes three-match shutout streak into regular-season finale
text:
San Jose Earthquakes at FC Dallas
6 p.m. today. TV: Ch. 21. Radio: KWRD-FM (100.7), KFLC-AM (1270 in Spanish).
About San Jose:
The Earthquakes (13-12-8, 47 points) need at least a draw to have any chance of making the playoffs. Even with a win, they would need help from the two teams ahead of them in the West, Seattle and Sporting Kansas City. ... San Jose defeated Sporting 1-0 at home on Oct. 23, the Quakes' second shutout over their last three matches. ... The Quakes are 5-9-2 on the road in 2015 with a minus-3 goal differential. ... F Chris Wondolowski, who has four goals and one assist in 22 career games against FCD, leads San Jose with 16 goals. ... GK David Bingham has 12 shutouts this season, tying a club record. ... D Clarence Goodson spent four seasons playing for Dallas. ... M Shea Salinas, a Carrollton product, made his 200th career appearance vs. Sporting KC.
Out: F Innocent Emeghara (left knee), M Anibal Godoy (suspension), F Steven Lenhart (right knee arthroscopy), M Jean-Baptiste Pierazzi (left foot), D Paulo Renato (right quadriceps), D Jordan Stewart (left Achilles).
About FC Dallas:
FCD (17-10-6, 57 points) equaled a franchise record with its 13th shutout of the season last weekend, a 1-0 win at Real Salt Lake. ... Dallas is 13-5-5 in 2015 when M Mauro Diaz starts. ... FCD beat San Jose 1-0 in the season opener on March 7 in Frisco thanks to a stoppage-time goal by F Blas Perez. ... GK Jesse Gonzalez has not allowed a goal in 324 consecutive minutes. ... FCD has allowed just 12 first-half goals, tied with Seattle for fewest in MLS. ... Dallas is 12-2-2 with a plus-17 goal differential at Toyota Stadium.
Questionable: M Kellyn Acosta (left hamstring strain), D Bakary Soumare (concussion symptoms). Out: M Rolando Escobar (facial fracture), M Alex Zendejas (international duty, U.S. U-17).
